bugs.title: CVE-2015-2206 phpMyAdmin: Risk of BREACH attack due to reflected parameter (PMASA-2015-1)

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-2206 phpMyAdmin: Risk of BREACH attack due to reflected parameter (PMASA-2015-1)

long_desc.thetext:
Risk of BREACH attack due to reflected parameter has been reported [1] for
phpMyAdmin.

[1]: http://www.phpmyadmin.net/home_page/security/PMASA-2015-1.php

4.2.x upstream commit: https://github.com/phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin/commit/d0f109dfe3b345094d7ceb49df0dbb68efc032ed
4.0.x upstream commit: https://github.com/phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin/commit/e1a68ad02c5b1a516b3787ce114ef6a6be004630
phpMyAdmin-4.3.11.1-1.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
phpMyAdmin-4.3.11.1-1.fc20 has been pushed to the Fedora 20 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
phpMyAdmin-4.3.11.1-1.fc21 has been pushed to the Fedora 21 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
phpMyAdmin-4.3.11.1-1.el7 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
phpMyAdmin4-4.0.10.9-1.el5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
phpMyAdmin-4.0.10.9-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of Fedora EPEL.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

epel-5 tracking bug for phpMyAdmin4: see blocks bug list for full details of the security issue(s).

This bug is never intended to be made public, please put any public notes
in the blocked bugs.

[bug automatically created by: add-tracking-bugs]

phpMyAdmin4-4.0.10.9-1.el5 has been submitted as an update for Fedora EPEL 5.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/phpMyAdmin4-4.0.10.9-1.el5

Package phpMyAdmin4-4.0.10.9-1.el5:
* should fix your issue,
* was pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 testing repository,
* should be available at your local mirror within two days.
Update it with:
# su -c 'yum update --enablerepo=epel-testing phpMyAdmin4-4.0.10.9-1.el5'
as soon as you are able to.
Please go to the following url:
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2015-1029/phpMyAdmin4-4.0.10.9-1.el5
then log in and leave karma (feedback).
phpMyAdmin4-4.0.10.9-1.el5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
